data.event: Today, the town is known for its music, its annual Roman Catholic pilgrimage and its role as a processing center for the surrounding cotton- and peanut-growing region.
In November 1955, Kita became a commune of average exercise.
On March 2, 1966, Kita became a commune of full exercise.
The town grew in the 1990s around the cotton industry, but this has since declined.
